messages.content: You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the first step to prepare the validation set for ImageNet?

The first step is to create a directory named 'validation' using the command `$ mkdir validation`, then move the file `ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar` into the 'validation' directory using `$ mv ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar validation`, and finally change into the 'validation' directory using `$ cd validation`.
How do you extract the contents of the validation set tar file?
You extract the contents of the validation set tar file by running the command `$ tar xf ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar` inside the 'validation' directory.
What should be done after extracting the validation set?

After extracting the validation set, you should move the jpeg files (ILSVRC2012_val_00000001.JPEG, ..., ILSVRC2012_val_00050000.JPEG) into 1,000 directories, each representing a unique category, using the provided script from the URL: https://github.com/juliensimon/aws/blob/master/mxnet/imagenet/build_validation_tree.sh.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
How many GPUs and instances were used in the vd_train_log?
The vd_train_log used 32 GPUs and 4 p3dn.24xlarge instances.
What was the final loss and learning rate at step 14050 in the vd_train_log?
At step 14050, the final loss was 0.985 and the learning rate was 0.00002.
What was the top1 and top5 accuracy at step 14075 in the eval_hvd_train.log?
At step 14075, the top1 accuracy was 75.821 and the top5 accuracy was 92.90.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What should you do after formatting the EBS volume?
After formatting the EBS volume, you should mount it on /data and then change the owner to ec2-user: ec2-user. You can refer to the AWS documentation if you do not know how to mount it.
What repositories should you download after mounting the EBS volume?

After mounting the EBS volume, you should download the MXNet repository and the TensorFlow models repository. You can do this by running the commands: `git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/models.git` and `git clone https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet.git`.
What is the purpose of using symbolic links in this setup?

The purpose of using symbolic links in this setup is for convenience. For example, you can create symbolic links such as `imagenet -> /data/models/research/inception/inception` and `mxnet -> /usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mxnet` to easily access these directories.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the file size and name of the first file listed in the table?
The first file listed in the table is "ILSVRC2012_bbox_train_v2.tar.gz" with a file size of 19537608 bytes.
Who is the owner and group of the file "imagenet_2012_bounding_boxes.csv"?
The owner and group of the file "imagenet_2012_bounding_boxes.csv" are both "root".
How long does it take to use im2rec.py on a t2.large instance according to the text?
It takes 1.5 days to use im2rec.py on a t2.large instance according to the text.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What do you need to do if you want to train on distributed GPUs?
If you want to train on distributed GPUs, you need to create multiple GPU instances with the same setting. For example, the text shows 8 p3dn.24xlarge instances.
What is the instance type and availability zone of the instances listed in the table?
The instance type of the instances listed in the table is p3dn.24xlarge, and they are all located in the us-west-2c availability zone.
Where can you find the remaining steps for setting up distributed GPU training?

You can find the remaining steps for setting up distributed GPU training on the website: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/dlami/latest/devguide/tutorial-horovod-tensorflow.html. Note that all code and all feature sets (TFRecord and RecordIO) must be on the same path on each server.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the purpose of the shell script snippet shown in the image description?

The shell script snippet is used for downloading the ImageNet dataset. It involves exporting a username and access key, navigating to a directory, renaming a file, and running a download script in the background while logging the output.
What are the specific commands included in the shell script for downloading the ImageNet dataset?

The specific commands in the shell script are:
```sh
$ export IMAGENET_USERNAME=[YOUR_USERNAME] 
$ export IMAGENET_ACCESS_KEY=[YOUR_ACCESS_KEY] 
$ cd imagenet/data 
$ mv imagenet_2012_validation_synset_labels.txt synsets.txt
$ nohup bash download_imagenet.sh . synsets.txt >& download.log &
```
What is suggested if the primary method for downloading the ImageNet dataset does not work?
If the primary method does not work, an alternative method labeled "Method 2" is suggested for downloading the ImageNet dataset manually.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What should be done after data transformation when backing up and copying to S3?
After data transformation, you should create a new bucket and sync or copy feature sets to the bucket. Additionally, you should create a snapshot of the EBS volume.
What resources are suggested for training on a single machine before getting started with training ResNet-50 Model with Horovod?

The resources suggested for training on a single machine are the RecordIO and TFRecord, which can be found at the following links:
https://medium.com/@julsimon/imagenet-part-2-the-road-goes-ever-on-and-on-578f09a749f9
https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/official/r1/resnet
What is the title of the hands-on guide for fast training ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod?

The title of the hands-on guide is "Hands-on Fast Training ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod," and it can be accessed at the following link:
https://daekeun.notion.site/Hands-on-Fast-Training-ImageNet-on-on-demand-EC2-GPU-instances-with-Horovod-eb49f580d1304082b497d91dec887dca
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the size of the ImageNet training and validation sets?
ImageNet consists of 138GB for the training set and 6.3GB for the validation set.
Why do you need additional space when working with ImageNet on an EC2 instance?
Additional space is needed because you need to extract tar files and transform them into feature sets like TFRecord and RecordIO.
What is an example command to create and attach a volume to an EC2 instance using AWS CLI?

An example command to create and attach a volume to an EC2 instance using AWS CLI is:
$ aws ec2 create-volume \ --size 1000 \ --region [YOUR_AWS_REGION] \ --availability-zone [YOUR_AZ] \ --volume-type sc1 \ --tag-specifications 'ResourceType=volume,Tags=[{Key=Name,Value=ImageNet}]' 
$ aws ec2 attach-volume \ --volume-id vol-[YOUR_EC2_volume_id] \ --instance-id i-[YOUR_EC2_instance_id] \ --device /dev/sdf
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What type of EC2 instance is recommended for distributed GPU training using Uber's Horovod or Tensorflow's DistributedStrategy?
For distributed GPU training using Uber's Horovod or Tensorflow's DistributedStrategy, it is recommended to use p3.16xlarge or p3dn.24xlarge EC2 instances.
What should you do if you do not want to increase the root volume size of the EC2 instance?
If you do not want to increase the root volume size of the EC2 instance, you can delete some conda environments such as Theano, Chainer, Caffe, and Caffe2 after logging in to the EC2 instance.
What is the default root volume size of the EC2 instance, and what is the recommended size?

The default root volume size of the EC2 instance is 75GB, but it is recommended to increase it to 100GB since training logs and model checkpoints are stored in the root volume if you do not modify the training configuration.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
Why is it important to install OpenCV when working with ImageNet raw data?
It is important to install OpenCV because if you do not install it, you cannot convert ImageNet raw data to RecordIO files since im2rec.py utilizes some OpenCV functions.
Why is Python2 recommended over Python3 for Tensorflow models repository?
Python2 is recommended over Python3 because many codes of the Tensorflow models repository do not work on Python3.
What steps are involved in extracting the training set for ImageNet?

The steps involved in extracting the training set for ImageNet include creating a directory named 'train', moving the ILSVRC2012_img_train.tar file to the 'train' directory, extracting the tar file, and then extracting each individual tar file within the directory. After extraction, you should check if the number of directories is 1,000.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What can you skip if you do not want to invent the wheel again?
You can skip step 1 if you do not want to invent the wheel again because everything is stored in the s3 bucket.
What is the title of the hands-on guide mentioned in the text?
The title of the hands-on guide is "Fast Training ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod."
Where can you find the hands-on guide for fast training ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod?
You can find the hands-on guide at the following URL: https://daekeun.notion.site/Hands-on-Fast-Training-ImageNet-on-on-demand-EC2-GPU-instances-with-Horovod-eb49f580d1304082b497d91dec887dca.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What are the two main resources referred to in the document for deep learning models?

The two main resources referred to are the code at https://github.com/aws-samples/deep-learning-models/blob/master/utils/tensorflow/preprocess_imagenet.py and the document at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ko_kr/dlami/latest/devguide/tutorial-horovod-tensorflow.html.
What is the command to preprocess ImageNet data using the provided script?

The command to preprocess ImageNet data is: 
```
python preprocess_imagenet.py \ --local_scratch_dir=[YOUR DIRECTORY] \ --imagenet_username=[imagenet account] \ --imagenet_access_key=[imagenet access key]
```
What should be done after data transformation according to the document?
After data transformation, you should create a new bucket and sync or copy feature sets to the bucket, and create a snapshot of the EBS volume.

How many GPUs and instances were used in the hvd_train_log?
The hvd_train_log used 64 GPUs and 8 p3dn.24xlarge instances.
What was the speed and loss at step 7000 in the hvd_train_log?
At step 7000 in the hvd_train_log, the speed was 41958.4 and the loss was 0.624.
How long did the training in the hvd_train_log take to finish?
The training in the hvd_train_log finished in 2685.1825189590454 seconds.

You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the goal of the document authored by Daekeun Kim?

The goal of the document is for people who need distributed GPU training using Horovod for experimental purposes. It provides steps and recommendations for setting up and troubleshooting the training process.
What type of instances are recommended for data preparation and transformation?
For data preparation and data transformation, it is recommended to use much cheaper instances like t2.large with 1.0TB EBS volume instead of GPU instances such as p2 and p3.
What type of instances are needed for distributed training?
For distributed training, multiple GPU instances like p2, p3, g3, and g4 are needed.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What are the different storage locations for the ImageNet dataset mentioned in the text?

The different storage locations for the ImageNet dataset mentioned are: s3://dataset-image/imagenet/raw (raw jpeg), s3://dataset-image/imagenet/tfrecord (TFRecord before resizing), s3://dataset-image/imagenet/tfrecord-resized (TFRecord after resizing to 224x224), and s3://dataset-image/imagenet/recordio (RecordIO after resizing to 256x256).
Why was the ImageNet dataset not resized to 224x224 in one of the storage locations?

The ImageNet dataset was not resized to 224x224 in one of the storage locations because the article at https://forums.fast.ai/t/impact-of-image-resizing-on-model-training-time-and-performance/1980 shows different validation accuracy for resizing strategy.
What are the steps for setting up an EC2 instance for data transformation of the ImageNet dataset?

The steps for setting up an EC2 instance for data transformation of the ImageNet dataset include creating an EC2 instance (Ubuntu 18.04 or 16.04, t2.micro is available but t2.large is recommended due to memory size), and creating an EBS volume (1.0TB) for the ImageNet dataset and attaching it to the EC2 instance.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
How can you use TensorFlow's download script to download the ImageNet dataset?

You can use TensorFlow's download script by exporting your username and access key. The steps include exporting your username and access key, navigating to the imagenet/data directory, renaming the validation synset labels file, and running the download script with nohup.
What is the alternative method if TensorFlow's download script does not work?
The alternative method involves downloading the ImageNet dataset manually using wget commands for different parts of the dataset, such as the training images, bounding boxes, and validation images.
How do you extract the validation set after downloading it manually?

To extract the validation set, you need to create a directory named validation, move the ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar file into this directory, navigate to the validation directory, and then extract the contents of the tar file using the tar xf command.
